section.title: Overview
section.para: Tools4j Config is a true open-source project under the Apache License, Version 2.0. Developers interested in building better Configuration Management for Java are more than welcome to participate.

There are many ways to join the project. The most efficient and appreciated way to contribute is through code, bug fixes and documentation, but there are other ways. Get familiar with full contributors, give useful feedback, feature suggestions, donate graphics/look-n-feel and more.

para.para: The most important rule is "Do No Harm" and can be summarized as follows:

listitem.para: Familiarize yourself with the existing code base and design.
Show good judgement in general and your own ability of what tasks to take on.
Be careful not to introduce bugs when coding.

para.emphasis: This is the current reflection of the team, but nothing in this document is written in stone. Conventions and principles should not be source of frustration and unnecessary constraints. If you have suggestions that can improve the project in *any* way, do not be afraid to express your opinion.

section.title: Tools
section.para: These are the suggested tools needed for doing developing. Some are required and others optional. Dependencies to newer Java and platform versions must be avoided. Development environment is preferably setup in Linux, but Windows will probably work as well. If any conflicts would between these operating systems, Linux takes preference.

para.emphasis: Make sure that Eclipse uses the same JRE version as the maven build. Development on other IDE's are also possible, but no guidance for doing this is available at the moment.

listitem.para: Activate FindBugs in Eclipse when working and check bugs regularly.
See Mylyn and GitHub userguide for more information.

para.emphasis: Configuring Code Templates, Code Formatter and Code Cleanup

section.para: It is mandatory for all Java code to have the same coding style. Eclipse Code Templates are used for this purpose.

In Eclipse, select Windows > Preferences > Code Style > Java.
Select Code Templates > Import... Browse for this file: env/eclipse_code_template.xml
Select Formatter > Import... Browse for this file: env/eclipse_code_style_formatter.xml
Select Clean Up > Import... Browse for this file: env/eclipse_code_style_cleanup.xml

section.title: Documentation
